too late to be sorry
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time

to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud

definition: to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.

to nip in the bud (idiom)
lit. the cart in front overturns, a warning to the following cart (idiom); fig. draw lesson from the failure of one's predecessor/learn from past mistake/once bitten twice shy

definition: to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
